subject: Re: [junit] fundamental questions on JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Are you speculating about this or do you know this to be true? If you are speculating about it, then let me suggest that you stop speculating and start
messageBody:
Quoting Anil and Rita Philip <anil_rita@...>:

> Vladimir,
> What I am trying to communicate is different from what
> you have written.

> 1) with the db there will be other issues like other
> processes touching the data etc.

Are you speculating about this or do you know this to be true? If you are
speculating about it, then let me suggest that you stop speculating and start
experimenting -- you may be surprised with the results. I have done this kind
of testing and not run into problems of other processes touching the data...

> 2) several paths through the program might produce the
> same output returned but only differ in the
> processing.

I'm not sure why this matters. Clients of a class need only be concerned about
the behavior and not the implementation. If you think there is input for which
a method might give the wrong output or do the wrong thing, then write a test
to confirm that, then fix the production code as required.

J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Let's write software that people understand.
